abstract: Inquiries loom over the bank’s purchase of Merrill Lynch, and the role that Kenneth D. Lewis and other executives played in not disclosing losses and bonus payouts.
snippet: Inquiries loom over the bank’s purchase of Merrill Lynch, and the role that Kenneth D. Lewis and other executives played in not disclosing losses and bonus payouts.
lead_paragraph: There is no easy exit for Kenneth D. Lewis.

headline.main: Lewis Still Faces a Gantlet of Legal and Political Woes
headline.print_headline: Lewis Still Faces a Gantlet Of Legal and Political Woes

abstract: The Dec. 31 departure of Kenneth D. Lewis has left the board at Bank of America scrambling for a successor.
snippet: The Dec. 31 departure of Kenneth D. Lewis has left the board at Bank of America scrambling for a successor.
lead_paragraph: Who will lead Bank of America out of this mess?

headline.main: Who Can Take Charge at Bank of America?
headline.print_headline: Who Can Take Charge at Bank of America?

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Louise Story

abstract: The American Academy of Actuaries will pay $600,000 to Bruce Schobel, who was to have become its president.
snippet: The American Academy of Actuaries will pay $600,000 to Bruce Schobel, who was to have become its president.
lead_paragraph: The American Academy of Actuaries said on Thursday that it had settled a lawsuit with Bruce D. Schobel, a Social Security expert it had ousted just as he was to become its president.

headline.main: Academy of Actuaries Settles Dispute With Bruce Schobel
headline.print_headline: Actuary Group Settles a Legal Dispute

abstract: Who will lead Bank of America out of this mess? That question is reverberating through Wall Street and Washington after the abrupt resignation of Kenneth D. Lewis, the bank’s beleaguered chief executive.
snippet: Who will lead Bank of America out of this mess? That question is reverberating through Wall Street and Washington after the abrupt resignation of Kenneth D. Lewis, the bank’s beleaguered chief executive.
lead_paragraph: Who will lead Bank of America out of this mess?

headline.main: What’s Next for BofA and Lewis

abstract: The swarm of legal and political troubles that prompted Kenneth D. Lewis to resign from his post atop Bank of America on Wednesday are likely to follow him long after he leaves.
snippet: The swarm of legal and political troubles that prompted Kenneth D. Lewis to resign from his post atop Bank of America on Wednesday are likely to follow him long after he leaves.
lead_paragraph: There is no easy exit for Kenneth D. Lewis.

headline.main: Lewis Still Faces Legal and Political Woes

abstract: The head of the Center for American Progress, an Obama adviser, calls for higher taxes.
snippet: The head of the Center for American Progress, an Obama adviser, calls for higher taxes.
lead_paragraph: The ranks of Club Wagner keep growing. John D. Podesta, the influential Democrat who heads the Center for American Progress and is an outside adviser to President Obama, is the latest member. From The Wall Street Journal:
